author: Herald Staff
title: Columbus Day freebies
text:
T he long weekend just got better, thanks to the Fenway Alliance’s 14th Opening Our Doors Day.
Thanks to the membership and service organization, Columbus Day brings free admission to galleries and museums, free performances and plenty of family friendly activities.
That makes a visit to the Isabella Stewart Gardner Museum a freebie on Monday, including access to the entire museum, even special exhibitions. Make sure you check out “Charmaine Wheatley: Souvenirs” while you’re there. There will be events in the courtyard from 11 a.m. until 4:30 p.m.
And the Museum of Fine Arts is also gratis on Columbus Day from 10 a.m. to 4:45 p.m. Featured is Sonya Clark’s performance art: “Hairdressers Are my Heroes,” with Boston stylist Kathy Montrevil, who will arrange Clark’s hair into an African hairstyle based on a sculpture in the collection — part of the installation “Crafted: Objects in Flux.” The museum’s open house includes art-making activities for families and tours; admission to all exhibitions, including “Class Distinctions: Dutch Painting in the Age of Rembrandt and Vermeer,” is free. See a video on bostonherald.com.
Out and about, the Lindy Bomb Squad dance troupe performs in the Christian Science Plaza area, there’s a kids parade with the Hot Tamale Brass Band, a chance to check out Fenway Open Studios, backstage tours of Wheelock Family Theatre and much, much more. Go to fenway culture.org for the full schedule of participating institutions and activities.
